AI 5 min read

The article presents ORBITFLOW, a novel approach designed to enhance the efficiency of serving long-context language models (LLMs) while adhering to specified Service Level Objectives (SLOs). It introduces a fine-grained key-value (KV) cache reconfiguration mechanism that optimizes cache management to reduce latency and improve performance under varying load conditions. This approach allows for dynamic adjustments to the LLM serving infrastructure, ensuring that the models can handle extensive context inputs without degrading service quality. New StackWarp Hardware Flaw Breaks AMD SEV-SNP Protections on Zen 1–5 CPUs

Tech 5 min read

Researchers have uncovered a hardware vulnerability, termed "StackWarp," that affects AMD's Secure Encrypted Virtualization-Secure Nested Paging (SEV-SNP) technology, compromising the security of Zen 1 through Zen 5 processors. The flaw enables potential attackers to manipulate the stack frame, allowing unauthorized access to sensitive data within encrypted virtual environments. This discovery raises significant concerns about the efficacy of AMD's hardware-based security features designed to protect virtual machines from being compromised.
